qas.question: What committee did Kerry chair in 1991-1993?

answers.text: the Senate Select Committee on POW/MIA Affairs

qas.question: What did the POW/MIA committee conclude about Vietnam POWs?

answers.text: there was "no compelling evidence that proves that any American remains alive in captivity in Southeast Asia."

qas.question: When did Kerry sponsor a resolution to reopen trade with Vietnam?
Who sponsored the resolution to reopen trade with Vietnam, along with Kerry?
When did Bill Clinton normalize relations with Vietnam?

context: Kerry chaired <a0_0>the Senate Select Committee on POW/MIA Affairs<a0_0/> from 1991 to 1993. The committee's report, which Kerry endorsed, stated <a1_0>there was "no compelling evidence that proves that any American remains alive in captivity in Southeast Asia."<a1_0/> In <a2_0>1994<a2_0/> the Senate passed a resolution, sponsored by Kerry and fellow Vietnam veteran <a3_0>John McCain<a3_0/>, that called for an end to the existing trade embargo against Vietnam; it was intended to pave the way for normalization. In <a4_0>1995<a4_0/>, President Bill Clinton normalized diplomatic relations with the country of Vietnam.
